block.p: In Poll, Americans Express Concern Over Warming Americans in large numbers say the heating of the earth's atmosphere is having serious effects on the environment and think it is necessary to take steps to reduce its effects, a New York Times/CBS News poll finds.
PAGE A20
Letter by Washington Found A letter written by George Washington in 1787 was discovered among the private papers of a prominent New Jersey family.
PAGE B1

U.S. Charges Officer in Iraq The American military has charged a commander at its main detention center in Baghdad with nine violations of military law, including ''aiding the enemy,'' a rare and serious accusation that could carry a death sentence.
PAGE A16
Jack Valenti Is Dead Jack Valenti, a confidant of President Lyndon B. Johnson who then led the Motion Picture Association of America for 38 years, devising its ratings system, was 85.
PAGE C10

Corzine Says He's 'Blessed' Gov. Jon S. Corzine of New Jersey, left, in his first public statement since he was critically injured in a car crash, said he felt blessed to have survived. He allowed a five-minute photo session at the Camden hospital where he is recuperating.
PAGE B5
Identifying Diabetes Genes Researchers said they had identified seven new genes connected to Type 2 diabetes, the most common form of the disease.
PAGE A22
Inquiry Into Atlanta Police After a fatal shooting in a botched drug raid, prosecutors say they are investigating a ''culture of misconduct'' in the Atlanta police.
